alert.note: Alert for Northern Berkshire; Southern Berkshire (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 14 at 10:06AM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...Heavy wet snowfall expected through 2PM with rates of 1 to 2 inches per hour... Bands of heavy snow continue to affect the Mohawk Valley, southern Adirondacks, northern and eastern Catskills, southern Greens and the Berkshires. The heavy snow will continue through 2 PM. Snowfall rates ranging 1 to 2 inches per hour combined with the heavy, wet nature of the snow weighing on trees and increasingly strong wind gusts 30 - 40mph will lead to dangerous travel conditions with additional power outages expected. The Berkshires, the eastern Catskills and southern Greens will likely receive the highest snowfall amounts nearing or exceeding 2 feet. Avoid all unnecessary travel.
